item.description:
Come for the day or stay at the Inn on the Lake!
Check it out...

Bike, walk, or rollerblade the Ashuwillticook Bike Path! Incase of rain, event is still on, but we'll do indoor activities instead (i.e. visit Norman Rockwell Museum, go out to eat, maybe take a train ride, etc.)

If you like to bike, you will love this event! If you do not bike, you can still join us and walk, rollerblade, relax or shop the outlet stores in Lee!

Arrive Saturday and stay overnight at a fabulous Inn at an amazing rate!

The Ashuwillticook bike path is my favorite bike path in New England.  It's around 22 miles round trip, but you do not have to do the whole thing if you do not want to.  It's scenic, peaceful, and pretty easy. 

Meet 11:00 am at the Lanesboro Lot. Directions below.

Bring your own snacks to have along the way

After the bike ride we'll grab a bite to eat in town and then head to the B&B to check in. I will present options of things we can do for the rest of the day and for Sunday. Such as:  kayaking, site seeing at places like Norman Rockwell Museum, Bridge of Flowers, or sit outside and relax, shop, go out for ice cream, etc.)

If it rains, we will still go and enjoy the indoor sights.  Keep in mind though, on our past trips when rain was predicted, we still had great weather to spend outdoors.

$97 per person single occupancy or $57 double.

If you would like to come just for the day feel free at no charge.

BIKE RENTALS AVAILABLE AT:  http://www.berkshireoutfitters.com/rentals.html

Meeting Location Changed from Adams to Lanesboro

Directions From the South, East and West/Mass Pike (I-90): Take Exit 2 in Lee. Follow US Rte. 20 west to US Rte. 7 north for 11 miles to downtown Pittsfield. At Park Square rotary follow East Street for 3.25 miles (East St. becomes Merrill Road after 1.5 miles) to intersection of MA Rte. 9 and MA Rte. 8. Continue straight through intersection on Rte. 8 north for 1.5 miles to Lanesborough-Pittsfield line. Turn left at lights for Berkshire Mall Road entrance and rail trail parking. Farnams Road rail trail parking lot is 3.5 miles further on Rte. 8 north.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking lot by the trail entrance.
item.name: Fun in The Berkshires (Bike, Walk, Rollerblade, Shop, Sightsee)
